description.p: PEBL is a free, open-source programming language and execution environment designed specifically for creating psychology experiments. It provides a comprehensive system for researchers to design, run, and collect data from psychological experiments.

PEBL includes a battery of 100+ ready-to-use psychological tests, cross-platform compatibility (Windows, Linux, macOS, and web browsers), and modern features including audio input, internationalization support, and WebAssembly deployment.
Major release with WebAssembly support, audio input, and enhanced internationalization

ul.li: Full WebAssembly/Emscripten support for browser-based experiments
SDL2-based audio input system with voice key capabilities
Comprehensive RTL text support for Arabic and Hebrew
Modernized font system with DejaVu and Noto fonts
AppImage build support for portable Linux distribution
Enhanced documentation including C++ API docs via Doxygen
